column4: extremely newbish question here, but does ubuntu need to be installed on a fat32 drive? my HD is NTFS, do i need to make a FAT32 partition on it? will that even work..?
Ubuntu uses ext3, not MS formatting

so what would i need to do to prepare my hard drive? I have one partition, NTFS, with winXP on it. i have partition magic, so do i just... make another partition with ext3? or can i make it fat32 and ubuntu takes care of the ext3 stuff during the install?
I'm the wrong person to ask about partitioning - the only Ubuntu installs I've done have been into empty harddrives!
